1.text: FOR I would not have you ignorant, brethren, that our fathers were all under the cloud, and all passed through the sea.

2.text: And all in Moses were baptized, in the cloud, and in the sea:

3.text: And did all eat the same spiritual food,

4.text: And all drank the same spiritual drink; (and they drank of the spiritual rock that followed them, and the rock was Christ.)

5.text: But with most of them God was not well pleased: for they were overthrown in the desert.

6.text: Now these things were done in a figure of us, that we should not covet evil things as they also coveted.

7.text: Neither become ye idolaters, as some of them, as it is written: The people sat down to eat and drink, and rose up to play.

8.text: Neither let us commit fornication, as some of them committed fornication, and there fell in one day three and twenty thousand.

9.text: Neither let us tempt Christ: as some of them tempted, and perished by the serpents.

10.text: Neither do you murmur: as some of them murmured, and were destroyed by the destroyer.

11.text: Now all these things happened to them in figure: and they are written for our correction, upon whom the ends of the world are come.

12.text: Wherefore he that thinketh himself to stand, let him take heed lest he fall.

13.text: Let no temptation take hold on you, but such as is human. And God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that which you are able: but will make also with temptation issue, that you may be able to bear it.

14.text: Wherefore, my dearly beloved, fly from the service of idols.

15.text: I speak as to wise men: judge ye yourselves what I say.

16.text: The chalice of benediction, which we bless, is it not the communion of the blood of Christ ? And the bread, which we break, is it not the partaking of the body of the Lord ?

17.text: For we, being many, are one bread, one body, all that partake of one bread.

18.text: Behold Israel according to the flesh: are not they, that eat of the sacrifices, partakers of the altar ?

19.text: What then ? Do I say, that what is offered in sacrifice to idols, is any thing ? Or, that the idol is any thing ?

20.text: But the things which the heathens sacrifice, they sacrifice to devils, and not to God. And I would not that you should be made partakers with devils.

21.text: You cannot drink the chalice of the Lord, and the chalice of devils: you cannot be partakers of the table of the Lord, and of the table of devils.

22.text: Do we provoke the Lord to jealousy ? Are we stronger than he? All things are lawful for me, but all things are not expedient.

23.text: All things are lawful for me, but all things do not edify.

24.text: Let no man seek his own, but that which is another’s.

25.text: Whatsoever is sold in the shambles, eat; asking no question for conscience’ sake.

26.text: The earth is the Lord’s, and the fulness thereof.

27.text: If any of them that believe not, invite you, and you will be willing to go; eat of any thing that is set before you, asking no question for conscience’ sake.

28.text: But if any man say: This has been sacrificed to idols, do not eat of it for his sake that told it, and for conscience’ sake.

29.text: Conscience, I say, not thy own, but the other’s. For why is my liberty judged by another man’s conscience ?

30.text: If I partake with thanksgiving, why am I evil spoken of, for that for which I give thanks ?

31.text: Therefore, whether you eat or drink, or whatsoever else you do, do all to the glory of God.

32.text: Be without offence to the Jews, and to the Gentiles, and to the church of God:

33.text: As I also in all things please all men, not seeking that which is profitable to myself, but to many, that may be saved.
